thread.title: Sharon Osbourne shows life-long love for Ozzy with amazing backstage snap of his last Black Sabbath gig
thread.title_full: Sharon Osbourne shows life-long love for Ozzy with amazing backstage snap of his last Black Sabbath gig

author: Vicki Newman
title: Sharon Osbourne shows life-long love for Ozzy with amazing backstage snap of his last Black Sabbath gig
text:
Sharon Osbourne celebrates Ozzy's final Black Sabbath gig (Photo: Copyright Unknown) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Sharon Osbourne showed the world just how much she loves Ozzy by sharing an intimate backstage snap. 
The X Factor judge captured the moment her husband walked off stage at his last ever Black Sabbath gig. 
The heavy metal band returned to their hometown of Birmingham to say farewell to their fans with one last performance at the weekend. 
After almost 50 years in the business, lead singer Ozzy and his bandmates played together for the final time. 
Sharon took to Instagram to share a picture of the moment Ozzy walked off the stage. Read More They got married in 1982 (Photo: MirrorPix) 
With sweat dripping down his face, he'd clearly given his all during his swansong. 
Alongside the picture, which sees a security guard wrapping a towel around Ozzy as he walks backstage, Sharon wrote: "Ozzy, the last time leaving the stage with @BlackSabbath. I first saw them when I was 16, Iâ€™m now 64. F**k, where did my life go?" 
One fan wrote back: "Your life went right where it was suppose to; creating & enriching a wonderful family, friends, and fans" 
Another said: "Life goes by too f**king fast that's for sure! I'm right there with you Sharon". 
It would have been an emotional night for all involved in the band and their followers. 
The rockers shared a video of their final song, as well as a T-shirt that read: "Keep calm, Black Sabbath is gone, the end". 
Sharon met Ozzy when she was 18 and her dad, Don Arden, was managing Black Sabbath. 
When Ozzy was sacked from the band in 1979, the pair began dating and Sharon started managing him as a solo artist. 
They tied the knot in 1982 and went on to have three children together, Aimee, Jack and Kelly. 
Their marriage has certainly had its ups and downs, but they've overcome it all. Like us on Facebook
